#Planning and Inspiration

I originally started this project as a personal endeavor. It was supposed to be a portrait of a period when I was getting accustomed to the cafe where I work as a waiter. However, over time, I decided to turn this project into an isometric illustration. Of course, I can also create a waiter's portfolio from this work, but my main goal throughout the process was to create an isometric room reminiscent of the European Side Magazine Office.

As I mentioned, this cafe is an isometric illustration of the cafe where I currently work (May 2024).

Throughout the process, I filled my phone with cafe photos for reference. Additionally, the cafe's Instagram account and Google images were among my main reference sources.

#Modeling

The modeling process was the most challenging stage. For the work I wanted to be identical to the flowers from Zimba, I devoted the most time to modeling. Since I didn't define how detailed the work would be from the start, it was also the stage where I lost my motivation the most, but I am quite satisfied with the final result. It turned out to be very similar to its real-life counterpart. However, I can say that I intentionally added some stylized touches.

#Texturing

I can say that texturing such a detailed project was very challenging for me. Because there were so many products, I had to use many materials. However, as I aimed to maintain a certain standard, I needed to make material assignments and naming as effective as possible. At the beginning, I couldn’t decide whether to proceed based on color or model. In the end, I settled on the stack naming method. First, I did a general color blocking and then continued with polishing on this material. Whenever a different material was needed, I duplicated the material. For example:

black → black_LessRough → black_LessRough_Metal

black → black_ForMiddleTable → black_ForMiddleTable_Metallic

Even though material assignments got complicated at some points, overall, it ensured the project was completed smoothly.

Regarding texturing, I want to create a much more stylized version of this project and texture it more detailed and realistically using Substance 3D.

#Lighting

I tried to mostly adhere to the real cafe lighting to illuminate the scene. This is actually quite challenging because the exterior and interior lighting mix together, but I tried to stay true to the spotlights and light colors as much as possible. #Animation

Animation was the part I spent the least time on. The project only includes camera animation. I am trying to improve this step by step, day by day.
